page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY Watts Dyke
page.content: Watt's Dyke runs{NE}to{SW}through grid squares 3032, 2932, 2931 and 2930. It is visible as a low mound about 2 feet high and 8 feet wide. It has been ploughed and permanent grass extends in a continous cover . In the summer of 1985 the Oswestry by-pass was about to be built across Watt's Dyke.Money was found from central Government to carry out a major excavation,on this feature for the first time ever.It set out to establish the Dykes purpose,this is for defense or military and to date it.
